title: Conclusion from the Mean Value Theorem

content.question: The figure above shows the graph of the differentiable function f for <math> <mrow> <mn>1</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>5</mn> </mrow> </math>. Which of the following could be the x-coordinate of a point at which the line tangent to the graph of f is parallel to the secant line through the points <math> <mrow> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mn>1</mn> <mo>,</mo> <mtext> </mtext> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mn>1</mn> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> </math> and <math> <mrow> <mrow><mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mn>5</mn><mo>,</mo><mtext> </mtext><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mn>5</mn> <mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow> <mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow> </math> ?

topic.text: 2.3: Estimating Derivatives of a Function at a Point

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Provide reasons or rationales for solutions and conclusions.
